COMMENT_TX: Debut game for Brennan Boesch
Debut game for Justin Smoak
$MLB says no WP per rule 10.12(f)(2)

ej,tream001,P,davib902,Balk call (while catching) $HP umpire Bob Davidson called the balk; Rangers catcher Matt Treanor snapped at Davidson, who snapped back; after some arguing, Davidson ejected Treanor

$Hamilton's fly cleared the 14-foot fence in LF and caromed back onto the field; 2B umpire Doug Eddings ruled it in play; Rangers manager Ron Washington argued with Eddings, who stood firm in his call, saying the ball hit the pad; Washington was convinced and left the field and crew chief Dana DeMuth did not watch the replay

$Ian Kinsler's grounder was fielded by Cubs 3B Mike Fontenot near the line about 20 feet in front of the bag; he threw the ball past 1B and it caromed off the wall back towards the field; Ryan Theriot picked it behind the bag in fair territory and threw it wildly to 2B; the ball went into LF and Kinsler ran to 3B
ej,washr001,M,guccc901,Call at 2B on CS Rangers Manager Ron Washington ejected by 2B umpire Chris Guccione

$Carlos Pena swung and missed strike three, which got past catcher Max Ramirez but bounced back towards him off the backstop; Evan Longoria was caught in a rundown while Pena reached first. No PB on this play

ej,kinsi001,P,coope901,Called third strike (Threw equipment) $after being called out on strikes, Ian Kinsler tossed his bat, helmet and shin guard towards the dugout in protest of the strike zone; he started to walk towards the infield while taking off his gloves and was ejected by HP umpire Eric Cooper
$the throw to first by Darren O'Day was wide on the infield side of the bag and was backed up by 2B Andres Blanco, who threw wildly to the plate
White Sox third baseman Omar Vizquel left the game due to an injured knee

replay,7,cruzn002,TEX,tscht901,ARL02,F,Y,I,,H $Nelson Cruz hit a fly down the RF line that skimmed the pole and was ruled a home run; the Indians asked about the call so crew chief Tim Tschida watched the replay and overturned the call to a foul ball

ej,actam801,M,timmt901,Checked swing $the third pitch to Jason Donald was a check swing; 1B umpire Tim Timmons called a swing and Indians manager Manny Acta, sitting in the dugout, took off his cap and swung his arm to indicate what he thought the hitter did; he was ejected by Timmons
Orioles catcher Matt Wieters left the game due to an injured leg
Orioles left fielder Felix Pie left the game due to an injured leg

$Chris Tillman picked off Elvis Andrus, who ran toward 2B after failing to get back to the 1B bag; 1B Jake Fox chased Andrus towards 2B and threw to 2B Julio Lugo; when Andrus turned back towards 1B, he ran into Fox; Fox was called for obstruction by 2B umpire Dale Scott
ej,custj001,P,danlk901,Called third strike Athletics designated hitter Jack Cust ejected by HP umpire Kerwin Danley
Debut game for Mitch Moreland
Rangers right fielder Nelson Cruz left the game due to an injured leg

replay,1,murpd005,TEX,cousd901,ARL02,O,N,I,,H $Twins center fielder Denard Span jumped for the ball but did not touch it; the ball hit the top of the padding and rebounded back onto the field; it was ruled in play; the umpires huddled and then crew chief Derryl Cousins watched the replay and upheld the call
$the first hit of the game by the Twins, with one out in the ninth
Athletics pitcher Brett Anderson left the game due to an injured knee
ej,kinsi001,P,scotd901,Called third strike Rangers second baseman Ian Kinsler ejected by HP umpire Dale Scott
$Ian Kinsler, who had been jected earlier, came onto the field with his teammates to welcome Nelson Cruz at HP; Kinsler was suspended one game since he was not allowed on the field during the game

replay,4,murpd005,TEX,laynj901,ARL02,F,N,I,,H $David Murphy's high fly down the RF line was ruled a fair ball by 1B umpire Jerry Layne; the Tigers complained about the call, so Layne, the crew chief, watched the replay and upheld the call

replay,1,rabur001,DET,laynj901,ARL02,O,N,I,,H $Ryan Raburn's fly hit the top of the wall and bounced back onto the field; the Tigers asked about the call so crew chief Jerry Layne watched the replay and upheld the call

ej,leylj801,M,laynj901,Balls and strikes $between innings, Tigers Manager Jim Leyland ejected by HP umpire Jerry Layne after Leyland yelled at Layne from the dugout; Leyland was still upset about a replay ruling from the previous day
Mariners third baseman Jose Lopez left the game due to an injured hand
Rangers second baseman Andres Blanco left the game due to an injured hand
Rangers right fielder David Murphy left the game due to an injured groin
Debut for umpire Mark Ripperger

$when Esteban German left 1B too early, Angels pitcher Fernando Rodney ran towards the baseline where German was standing; Rodney looked at 3B once but then forgot about Mitch Moreland, who scored ahead of a late throw home while German advanced to 2B
